name: Early Days of Hollywood Quiz | Classic Movies | 10 Questions

questions.text: Robert Donat won the Oscar for which of these movies?
options: The Private Life of Henry VIII
questions.explanation:
Goodbye, Mr. Chips

	Donat was in "Monte Cristo" and "39 Steps" (by Hitchcock) and had a supporting role in "Private Life" (which starred Charles Laughton). He won for "Chips", however ... beating Clark Gable's Rhett Butler in the process.

questions.text: Which of these actors starred in "Lost Horizon", "Tale of Two Cities" and "Prisoner of Zenda"?
questions.explanation:
Ronald Colman.

	Colman, a popular leading man, starred in all three. Huston, who had a fine career, may be best-remembered for his role in "Treasure of the Sierra Madre" (with Humphrey Bogart as Fred C. Dobbs). Brent was a popular leading man who starred in "The Spiral Staircase" (among other movies). Beutel is best-known for his role in "The Outlaw" (with Jane Russell).

questions.text: Al Jolson starred in the first talkie, "The Jazz Singer". Who played him in "The Jolson Story"?
questions.explanation:
Larry Parks.

	Parks did a splendid job in the role. (Danny Thomas also took a shot later at the story of Al Jolson; Peggy Lee co-starred. Later, of course, Neil Diamond took a run at it.)As for the legendary Jolson, what can one possibly say?

questions.text: Which of the following movies did NOT feature Paul Muni?
questions.explanation:
They Made Me A Criminal.

	Muni, who seemed to be everywhere for a while, played the starring roles in "Scarface", "Pasteur" and "Juarez". "Criminal", however, starred John Garfield and Claude Rains.

questions.text: Which movie did NOT star Roy Rogers?
questions.explanation:
Back in the Saddle.

	Rogers is often identified with the songs from "Yellow Rose" and "Fence". "Sons of the Pioneers" was the name of his "back-up" singing group. "Saddle", however, is associated with another legendary cowboy: Gene Autry.

questions.text: In which movie did Greta Garbo speak the famous line: "I want to be alone"?
questions.explanation:
Grand Hotel.

	Garbo was famous for all of these (and other) roles, but the line came from "Grand Hotel".

questions.text: Alice Faye starred in "Alexander's Ragtime Band". Who was her co-star?
questions.explanation:
Tyrone Power.

	All of the other choices were stars in their day, but Power was the man in this one.

questions.text: Norma Shearer starred in "The Women". Which of the following was also in the cast?
questions.explanation:
Rosalind Russell.

	Shearer didn't handle the transition to talkies all that well.  Swanson will always be rmembered for her role in "Sunset Boulevard". Sothern had a career in both movies and TV.

questions.text: Leslie Howard may be best remembered for his role of Ashley Wilkes in "Gone With The Wind", but he had other fine performances. What actor starred with him in both "Petrified Forest" and "Of Human Bondage"?
questions.explanation:
Bette Davis.

	Bogart plays a tough guy in "Forest", but he isn't in "Bondage". Davis gives one of her better-known performances in "Bondage" and is also good in "Forest". Main starred in the "Ma and Pa Kettle" films.

questions.text: Claude Rains is perhaps best remembered for his supporting role ("Louie") in "Casablanca", but he had a fine career that included many other movies. Which movie marked his debut?
questions.explanation:
The Invisible Man.

	He starred in "Man" and "Phantom" and had supporting roles in "Jordan" (he was Mr. Jordan, but Robert Montgomery was the star) and "Robin Hood" (he played Prince John to Errol Flynn's Robin).
